definition: to temporarily transfer (personnel)
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
variant of 借[jie4]
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: He is on loan to the Foreign Languages Press.
sentences.chinese: 他借调到外文出版社工作去了。

sentences.english: Under certain conditions, the partnership may involve the secondment of corporate personnel as well.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情况下，合作关系也可能需要借调企业人员。

sentences.english: Susan has been on loan to the affiliated plant as an interpreter since last month.
sentences.chinese: 苏姗从上个工始就被借调到附属厂去当口译人员。

sentences.english: My colleagues are all received they secondment outline.
sentences.chinese: 我的同事都收到他们借调的轮廓。

sentences.english: He was at the beginning of the electrical company on secondment , Qugao enterprise reform.
sentences.chinese: 他开始时是被电机公司借调，去搞企业体制改革。

sentences.english: The rules governing selection and temporary transfer for the position of Judge Assistant shall be determined by Judicial Yuan.
sentences.chinese: 法官助理之遴聘事项及借调办法，由司法院定之。

sentences.english: I just have a question, why I didn't receive the secondment outline?
sentences.chinese: 我只是有一个问题，为什么我没有收到借调的轮廓？

sentences.english: He was sent to the U.N. secretariat on secondment from the Government of France.
sentences.chinese: 他是由法国政府借调到联合国秘书处去工作的。

sentences.english: Three teachers have been loaned to the English Department.
sentences.chinese: 3位教师已暂时借调给英文系。

sentences.english: It was also seconded from district technology backbone to help.
sentences.chinese: 另外还从各区借调技术骨干来帮助工作。

definition: temporary assignment to a Chinese government or CCP post
to transfer (personnel or material)
to transfer/to move to another post
to appoint
to hold an office or post
to be transferred to another post/to post away
to sow discord
to send (products)/to allocate/to commit (funds)/to channel (goods)
to select/to detail/to set apart/to appoint
to dispatch (sb) in an official capacity/to be posted (as an ambassador, foreign correspondent etc)
to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
public business/official work
to send (on a mission)/to dispatch
to assign/to appoint/assignment
to bring in/to call in/to transfer (a person, data)/(computing) to call/to load (a subroutine etc)
main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
to dispatch/to assign/a dispatch
